data.title: Auto generated bindings for scripts
data.body: Script binding is manually generated. Some low-level classes and methods are not exported. We have to handle two (for now) or more script languages and add bindings to them. There should be some way to auto generate all the glue layer so we can even write the game using script only.

data.title: Document a way to efficiently set/update a large number of CollisionShapes in a Node
data.body:
Currently if one wants to add or update (eg.) a box collision shape in a Node, it is done by calling CollisionShape::SetBox() and CollisionShape::SetPosition(). When having many CollisionShapes in a single node, these add up to a ridiculous amount of resource waste and an unusably slow update speed.

The CollisionShape::Set_() methods always cause a call to RigidBody::UpdateMass() which is a very heavy operation causing the RigidBody to recreate the Bullet compound shape out of all the currently existing CollisionShapes, only to be called soon again when the next CollisionShape::Set_() is called.

I didn't see this described anywhere, but by looking at the source code long enough, I found that doing this efficiently is possible via this quite unintuitive way:

First of all, I think it is possible to just remove the RigidBody and create it again after creating and/or updating the CollisionShapes, but then you lose all the properties set in the RigidBody in addition to causing an unnecessary network update (if using networking) and so on. But then...

It is possible to call RigidBody::ReleaseBody() before managing the CollisionShapes. This takes advantage of the fact that if RigidBody::body_==NULL, UpdateMass() does nothing. After updating all the CollisionShapes, RigidBody::OnSetEnabled() can be called to cause a call to the private RigidBody::AddBodyToWorld(), which will create the RigidBody::body_ and it also calls stuff like RigidBody::UpdateMass(), making everything directly work again very efficiently.

I couldn't find a better place to post this. Hopefully this will end up helping someone.

data.title: Fix Variant:SetBuffer and VariantMap:SetBuffer in Lua
data.body: Without this fix, any data starting with 0 will be copied as being zero length, and I guess it might segfault if there are no null bytes in the data.

data.title: Connection::SyncPackages method. Can be called server and client connection.
data.body:
Connection SyncPackages method. Can be called by server or client connection.
In first case it begin synchronization of packages with all clients.
In second case client send message to server to begin synchronization of packages with all clients or with only this client.

data.title: AreaAllocator wouldnt increase size if next size was exactly max
data.body: I set the area allocators max texture size to 2048 and added Data/Textures/Jack_face.jpg a 1024x1024 + 1px padding so 1025x1025 to the area allocator and it would not allocate up to 2048.  This patch fixed it on my end.

data.title: Class HashBase has no virtual destructor.
data.body:
I just saw that the class HashBase, which is the base class for all hash-container has a not virtual destructor. This will cause a memory leak. 

Fix is simple: just make hashbase destructor virtual.

data.title: Segfault in Lua binding for Text3D::SetFaceCameraMode
data.body:
Mingw-w64, 64-bit build w LuaJIT, no OpenGL

Calling Text3D::SetFaceCameraMode from Lua causes a segfault. Inspecting the generated UILuaAPI.cpp definition for tolua_set_Text3D_faceCameraMode shows that tolua is generating code as if FaceCameraMode were a class or struct type rather than an enum. You can see the difference by inspecting the generated tolua_set_Text3D_textEffect function, where the type from the top of the Lua stack is cast to a number using tolua_tonumber before being passed to the object method, ie:

self->SetTextEffect(((TextEffect) (int)  tolua_tonumber(tolua_S,2,0))

 whereas the faceCameraMode function casts the stack value to a pointer of type *FaceCameraMode, then derefs that pointer and passes the value at the dereferenced location to SetFaceCameraMode:

self->SetFaceCameraMode(_((FaceCameraMode_)  tolua_tousertype(tolua_S,2,0))

Clearly, this is undesirable behavior. I believe that the difference lies in the fact that the textEffect enum is bound to Lua within the UILua library, whereas the FaceCameraMode enum is bound within the GraphicsLua library. It is possible that at the point that UILuaAPI.cpp is generated, tolua only sees the name FaceCameraMode without context and assumes that FaceCameraMode is a class/struct rather than an enum.

Adding the FaceCameraMode enum definition to the top of Text3D.pkg solves the issue; however, I am unsure if duplicating an enum in 2 places in the bindings is really the best solution.

data.title: node.Remove() sometimes crashes the engine
data.body:
Win 7 64bit, opengl, deferred renderer, 32 bit build. Source updated to recent. Angel script.

I am creating the ragdoll in the way similar to Ragdolls sample. After the ragdoll is created I want to remove the ragdoll after some time (let's say 5 seconds). So I'm creating ScriptInstance which calls node.Remove() after some time - the same way as in NinjaSnowWar GameObject duration.

I have some random crash about 1 crash per 3 ragdolls, so quite often. Crash dump is generated and the logs doesn't show anything. Crash dump tells that "thread wanted to read virtual address without appropriate access"

Additionally, the crash doesn't happen in Remove() method, when I replace node.Remove() by

```
        Print("before");
        node.Remove();
        Print("after");
```

then I can see that the word "after" is the last word in the log.

I understand that the bug might be difficult to locate. Here is the node structure I try to Remove(saved after ragdoll creation, but before deletion, crash also happens in editor). The script instance is custom script which removes own node after some time and the Remove() is the last instruction.

Btw. when I switch node.Remove() to node.SetEnabledRecursive(false) the crash doesn't happen, so I will use that for now. How efficient is disabling node and all children instead removing the node?

Moreover, when I don't create the rigidbodies and constraints for ragdoll, then there is no crash too.
Here is the node tree.

![nodetree](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2963404/4589120/7e94b6ec-504f-11e4-965b-9be8beee49e2.png)

data.title: Minor issue with no scene passes
data.body:
Hello,

on the last revision b059 I see a segfault when using a renderpath without a scenepass, for example:

```
<renderpath>
    <command type="quad" vs="CopyFramebuffer" ps="CopyFramebuffer" >
        <texture unit="diffuse" name="Textures/HeightMap.png" />
    </command>
</renderpath>
```

When there are no scenepasses the octree is not built and the fault starts [here](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/b0598282d996b3d7b7d187f9644fdd0e5619e2a0/Source/Engine/Graphics/View.cpp#L716).
There is a check [here](https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/b0598282d996b3d7b7d187f9644fdd0e5619e2a0/Source/Engine/Graphics/View.cpp#L498) but in this case hasScenePasses_ is false.

data.title: SpritePacker cli
data.body: This is a basic cli program that packs a bunch of pngs into a single large one and generates an urho3d specific xml file.

data.title: SceneReplication sample: reconnect to server failed if server restarted
data.body:
How to reproduce this:
- Start Server
- Start Client and connect to server
- Disconnect client from server, but not close it
- Stop server, but not close it
- Start Server
- Start Client and try to connect to server

data.title: CI & Snapshot repository
data.body:
@weitjong, do you think it would be good to set a less heavy loaded directory at Sourceforge's browser?

In the `/Urho3D/Snapshots` there's all releases for all platforms.

For the snapshots, would it be convenient to create an additional level to the structure as :

**/** Urho3D **/** Snapshots **/** `{PRODUCT_BUILD_NUMBER (1087)}` **/** `{PRODUCT_NAME (Urho3D)}` **-** `{PRODUCT_RELEASE (1.31)}` **.** `{PRODUCT_BUILD_NUMBER (1087)}` **-** `{PRODUCT_PLATFORM (iOS)}` **-** `{PRODUCT_BINARY_TYPE (STATIC)}` **-** `{PRODUCT_ENVIRONMENT (snapshot)}` **.** `{PRODUCT_ARCHIVE_EXTENSION (tar.gz)}`
(e.g.: /Urho3D/Snapshots/**1087**/Urho3D-1.31.1087-iOS-STATIC-snapshot.tar.gz)

or maybe

**/** Urho3D **/** Snapshots **/** `{PRODUCT_PLATFORM (iOS)}` **/** `{PRODUCT_NAME (Urho3D)}` **-** `{PRODUCT_RELEASE (1.31)}` **.** `{PRODUCT_BUILD_NUMBER (1087)}` **-** `{PRODUCT_PLATFORM (iOS)}` **-** `{PRODUCT_BINARY_TYPE (STATIC)}` **-** `{PRODUCT_ENVIRONMENT (snapshot)}` **.** `{PRODUCT_ARCHIVE_EXTENSION (tar.gz)}`
(e.g.: /Urho3D/Snapshots/**iOS**/Urho3D-1.31.1087-iOS-STATIC-snapshot.tar.gz)

Or do you rely on the actual structure for a specific purpose?
Let me know if this would make sense and help against heavy loads.

data.title: Adapt build scripts so they build cleanly on Travis CI OSX build environment which has just been updated to Xcode 6.0.1 with iOS 8 SDK today.
data.body:
Today Travis CI team has bumped the versions of the pre-installed software components in the OSX VM that causes a few minor issues on our CI builds. This is what I see in the preliminary assessment.
1. ~~Mac OSX 10.8 SDK has been removed. Impact: OSX build for deployment target 10.8 is now not possible on Travis CI. Proposed solution: a) bump the deployment target to 10.9 or b) try to install 10.8 SDK first before building.~~
2. AppleClang 6.0 produces too many warnings in the output. Impact: iOS 64-bit build gets terminated by Travis CI as it generates log file bigger than their threshold (4 MB). Proposed solution: a) exclude test building the Mach-O universal binary (again) to cut down the log generated or b) bite the bullet to do something on those warnings.

data.title: Upload files or packages on server
data.body: May be good idea to allow clients upload files or packages on server.

data.title: Parent UI element with vertical layout remains too tall after adding child text elements with wordwrap
Scrollview element population
General UI drag changes
data.body:
Changes to UI drag behaviour:
- Multi-touch drag support
- Combo press touch support -- you get id mask of pressed buttons + number of buttons + the average of their positions

Line edit now has a numeric mode:
- Supports setting a precision for # of decimal points formatting.
- Supports drag editing; can set increment amount, increment smoothing, button mask to activate the drag.
- E_TEXTFINISHED is sent when LineEdit is defocused (press enter, escape, press away from it / finishing a drag).

---

_The scripting isn't set up properly_, in particular I got stuck when trying to describe return values for HashMaps. It would also be good if the editor was also updated to reflect the numeric mode in the attributes editor.

One extra thing that would make drag editing with LineEdit better is to overcome the screen-boundary. Currently if you do turn it on in the editor, you'll notice dragging near the edge of the window will limit drag editing usefulness.

data.title: sprintf
data.body:
Hey,

While poking around in Str.h,  I noticed some possible problems with the use of sprintf. I'm hoping someone knowledgeable about these things could look into it.
- It's probably possible to overflow/overrun the constructor String(float). Looking here: [Link](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1701055/what-is-the-maximum-length-in-chars-needed-to-represent-any-double-value), floats can have 154 characters and doubles (which aren't in urho yet) could have 1078 -- the current conversion buffer is 128.
- If I wanted to expose sprintf format string (eg: String(float, formatString) ), it would likely be susceptible to format string exploits. [Link](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uncontrolled_format_string)
- Simply adding 0 to ensure null character end might split UTF8 character (and also doesn't prevent overrun).

A safe version of sprintf/snprintf would be good (or extend AppendWithFormatArgs?).

data.title: Allow to set prevent change of modal attribute when ESC key pressed in modal window.
Procedural geometry creation?
A way to override global ResourceCache
data.body:
I am making a thing where I need to sandbox the loading of resources in order to limit them to a certain directory (or preferably even memory-only), and in order to keep track of loading them.

Currently ResourceCache has no virtual methods (so replacing the subsystem with an inherited one doesn't work), and has no way of plugging in an external resource loader which would override the default load-from-anywhere-on-disk functionality.

Especially problematic are the references to other files from XML files (and elsewhere?), which cannot be catched by wrapping the ResourceCache in Lua, and which can load arbitrary (even absolute) paths.

What would be the preferred way of doing this?

data.title: SetDeepEnabled
data.body:
Commit message:

```
Added UIElement methods SetDeepEnabled / ResetDeepEnabled / IsDeepEnabled to allow setting enable on an element + all its child elements / reset it to previous state.

Example usage: On scroll view, could disable all children while touch-scrolling to prevent accidental triggering of items.
```

I probably didn't get the scripting thing right-- I didn't see where the similar UIElement methods were.

I've got a follow up pull-request for scroll view to do as in the example, if this is accepted.

data.title: Revert back for Animated sprites documentation
Fix Animated sprites documentation
[Request] 2D Ilumination (Color Lights + Shadows + Normals)
data.body:
I see nice changes in the 2D side of the engine and i like add ideas to this:
- Add option to use lights.
- Add color lights and color blend, and collision with object
- Add shadows, select if collide with the light and the value of shadow.
- Add penumbra and dark zones.
- Add normal map for detail the light in the sprites
- 2D Examples shaders & light.

Sources:
http://robotloveskitty.tumblr.com/post/33164532086/legend-of-dungeon-dynamic-lighting-on-sprites
http://www.gamedev.net/page/resources/_/technical/graphics-programming-and-theory/dynamic-2d-soft-shadows-r2032

data.title: Touch emulation bug fix
data.body: There was an issue with touch emulation (as least on windows), where releasing mouse didn't stop the mouse from being tracked. This pull request fixes the issue (the case handler for SDL_FINGERMOTION was creating a new touches_ entry on request-- after SDL_FINGERUP cleared it).
